data.title: Southern Maryland Volunteer Firemans Association
data.text:
In 2019, Mr. Keith Fairfax, a former MetCom Board member and Chairman, and a Past President, Past Fire Chief, and life member of the Bay District Volunteer Fire Department, established a dedicated Scholarship Fund to support the education and training of the children and grandchildren of St. Mary’s County Metropolitan Commission employees. This fund assists with both traditional college tuition and ... (Full Story & Photos)

This year marks the 50th anniversary of the first National EMS Week, a milestone that highlights the significant evolution of emergency medical services (EMS) and the selfless dedication of its professionals. As we honor half a century of commitment and service, it's essential to recognize not only the past achievements but also to look forward to the future of EMS.

Emergency medical services have ... (Full Story & Photos)

The Membership, and apparatus committee is proud to announce that we have received the final drawings for our new Engine. This unit will be a 2024 pierce arrow XT, powered by a Cummins X12 525 horsepower motor. This unit is equipped with a Hale 1500 gpm fire pump and will carry 750 gallons of water, 30 gallons of foam, various attack lines and other equipment. This unit will be designated as Engine ... (Full Story & Photos)

At 1415 hours, Area box 615 was dispatched for the detached garage fire in the 7000 block of Dorothy Drive. Engine 12, Tower 1, Chief 1A & Safety 1 responded from Company 1. Units from Huntingtown arrived to find a 2 story, detached garage with heavy fire showing. Engine 12 arrived as the 2nd Engine, completing Huntingtown’s split lay & assisted with extinguishment.

Tower 1 arrived as the 1st due ... (Full Story & Photos)

This afternoon, crews were alerted for an inaccessible terrain rescue off of Mason Springs Road. ATV-8 was used to transport the patient out to the ambulance. The patient was flown to a local trauma center for evaluation and treatment.... (Full Story & Photos)

On Friday, April 26th Sunderland Elementary hosted a Fun Run in support of their Boosterthon. CALS members Sean and Shane McKeever stopped by to cheer our young community members on as they worked hard to raise money for the redesigning and updating of the media center. Sunderland Elementary was able to raise ~$23,000 for their Media Center redesign. Way to go!”... (Full Story & Photos)

CPSC Warns Consumers to Stop Using Montebello ST and DRT63ST Gas Fireplaces; Multiple Fires Reported

WASHINGTON, DC – The U.S. Consumer Product Safety Commission (CPSC) is warning consumers about the risk of death and serious injuries from certain Innovative Hearth Products (IHP) gas fireplaces. CPSC urges consumers to immediately stop using the Montebello ST and DRT63ST fireplaces.

The window glass ... (Full Story & Photos)
